section.name: What to download?
section.p: In the directory binaries you will find subdirectories containing executables corresponding to your operating system. If your machine is not in the list, please mail us and we will try to make it available, or you can try to build it on your own. The files are compressed tar files. They are named jvm_name-os_name. For example: In the directory freebsd we have jdk1.4.1-FreeBSD_4.9.tar.gz That is a file built on FreeBSD 4.9 using the FreeBSD JVM 1.4.1.

section.name: How do I get the executable?

subsection.name: jsvc
subsection.p:
Do the following:
Find the tar file corresponding to your configuration.
Download it.
Uncompress the tar file and extract it (better with gnu tar).
Copy the executable to the location where you want to run it.
Write an rc shell (see in src/samples and src/native/unix/native/Tomcat.sh) to get your java application started as a daemon.

subsection.name: procrun
subsection.p: The procrun.exe has to be installed as a service (see procrun for more information).
